alert.note: Alert for Monroe (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 5:00PM EST until February 19 at 2:23AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western New York, including the following county, Monroe. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall and snow melt. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 454 PM EST, gauge reports indicated heavy rain and snowmelt. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rochester, Areas near Irondequoit Creek in Irondequoit, East Rochester, Brighton, Penfield and Pittsford. - For more information see http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
